GlobalParameter.description: time step for spacecraft electric field monitoring (0 => none, -n => n times)
Verbosity level (level of screen messages about code execution)
Same as verbose, but specific to Poisson solver
Same as verbose, but specific to CPU monitoring
control of output collected fluxes type, either C/m2/s = A/m2 (i.e. a current) or #/m2/s (i.e. a flux), 1=currents, 2=fluxes, 4=automatic (from known particle type)
time step for spacecraft local potential monitoring (0 => none, -n => n times)
cumulate currents and densities at the end of simulation ? 0=no, 1or2=yes
Select the export mode for all data fields (None=no export, ASCII=ASCII multi-files)
plot log10 of currents? 0=no, 1=yes(log only), 2=both
time step for densities monitoring (0 => none, -n => n times)
time step for spacecraft ground potential monitoring (0 => none, -n => n times)
Probability to plot a particle trajectory = one over particleTrajectoriesPeriod
starts plotting trajectories after this time
cutoff for density log plots
time step for plasma potential monitoring (0 => none, -n => n times)
time step for numerical behaviour monitoring through 3D maps of superparticle numbers, one in #/element and one in #/node (0.0 => none, -n => n times)
time step for plasma electric field monitoring (0 => none, -n => n times)
Select the export mode for density data fields (None=no export, ASCII=ASCII multi-files)
control of output density type, either amu/m3 or #/m3, 1=amu, 2=#, 4=automatic (from known particle type)
cutoff for current log plots
flag for plotting material properties: 0=no, 1=yes
cumulate currents and densities between monitoring steps for improved statistics (0=no, 1=yes(improved only), 2=both)?
time step for kinetic energy monitoring (0 => none, -n => n times)
maximal number of particle trajectories followed per PIC population
if finalCumulation=1 starting time for final dens-current cumulation, if finalCumulation=2 fraction of the simulation at which cumulation starts
plot log10 of densities? 0=no, 1=yes(log only), 2=both
time step for spacecraft local currents monitoring (0 => none, -n => n times)
time step for numerical behaviour monitoring (0.0 => none, -n => n times)
Select the export mode for potential data fields (None=no export, ASCII=ASCII multi-files)
time step for current density vectors monitoring (0 => none, -n => n times)
weighing factor for the presence of positive space charge in a positive sheath, which leads to jCLfact reduction to avoid instabilities
lower bound for jCL factor
weighing factor for the presence of a re-attracting electric field at boundary between zones, which leads to a jCLfact reduction
convergence speed for jCL factor
number of Poisson-Vlasov loops within each jCL factor adjusting iteration in a HybridMZVolDistrib
densification coefficient (increases superparticle number, decreasing their weight) for PIC electrons emitted at zone boundary
number of loops for adjusting jCL factor within a HybridMZVolDistrib
coefficient ruling the lower boundary on Ne estimate for jTh computation: small => less constraint, big => ne close to ni
smoothing strengh for jCL factor at each iteration
upper bound for jCL factor
weighing factor for the presence of an extracting electric field at boundary between zones, which leads to a jCLfact increase

If PotentialSweep: Initial potential of 3rd node

If PotentialSweep: Minimal Id node number

2nd parameter that can be used by some BC types
Tolerance for conjugate gradient Poisson Solver when non-linear solving
gamma adiabatic exponent in the variable Te law
if 1 linear Poisson solver, if 0 non-linear
flag for vacuum computation (0=off, 1=on), if on and linearPoisson is on solves Laplace equation, if on and linearPoisson is off only sets ion space charge to zero in Poisson eq.
flag to use a variable Te in Boltzmann equation (physically meaningless), 0=off, 1=on
constant in the variable Te law
Maximum iteration number for conjugate gradient Poisson Solver
Maximum iteration number for linear system solver (used for capacitance matrix inversion)
Tolerance for linear system solver (used for capacitance matrix inversion)
Maximum iteration number for Newton algorithm in non-linear Poisson solving
neutrality switch, 0=off => regular Poisson computation, 1=on => imposes neutrality instead of solving Poisson
Poisson boundary conditions type, see documentation
Parameter that can be used by some BC types (e.g. 1/rn exponent)
Tolerance for Newton algorithm loop in non-linear Poisson solving
Tolerance for conjugate gradient Poisson Solver
Maximum iteration number for conjugate gradient non-linear Poisson Solver

plot erosion products trajectory? 0=no, 1=yes

bits go by groups of 3 (bit0=on/off, bit1=simulate_secondary_elec_dynamics/don t, bit2=allow_secondaries_of-secondaries/don t), while groups of 3 bits are for ambient population 1, ambient population 2, source 1, source 2, source 3 and source 4 resp.
global temperature factor for the current scaler specific to GEO potential barrier phenomenon (BarrierCurrentScaler) for photo/secondary electron recollection (for expert users only)
plot photo electron trajectory? 0=no, 1=yes
densification coefficient for erosion product superparticles
if 0 no surface conductivity, if 1 surface conductivity turned on
secondary electron temperature (from electron impact)
secondary electron temperature (from proton impact)
densification coefficient for secondary electron superparticles (from proton impact)
local temperature factor for the current scaler specific to GEO potential barrier phenomenon (BarrierCurrentScaler) for photo/secondary electron recollection (for expert users only)
densification coefficient for secondary electron superparticles (from electron impact)
Type of particles emitted by the first interactor if it is an emitter
volume population to be used as source of the interaction of this first interactor (must be one of the predefined volume population names ions1, elec1, source1, photoElec...)
if 0 no induced conductivity, if 1 induced conductivity turned on
plot secondary electron trajectory? 0=no, 1=yes

x-component of sun direction (points to sun, component of sun direction (points to sun, vector opposite to photons' velocity, vector norm corresponds to the amplification factor wrt the reference flux at 1 AU))
Numerical times speed-up factor erosion products
flag for defining a first generic interactor on the spacecraft: 0 => none, 1 => yes, x => number of super-particles densified by x if relevant
flag for the current scaler specific to GEO potential barrier phenomenon for photo/secondary electron recollection (0 = off, 1 = on)
Numerical times speed-up factor for particles from first artificial interactor on SC

bits go by groups of 3 (bit0=on/off, bit1=eroded_products_dynamics/don t, bit2=unused), while groups of 3 bits are for ambient population 1, ambient population 2, source 1, source 2, source 3 and source 4 resp.
Name of the first Interactor class to be used for an interactor on the spacecraft
number of interactors

z-component of sun direction (points to sun, component of sun direction (points to sun, vector opposite to photons' velocity, vector norm corresponds to the amplification factor wrt the reference flux at 1 AU))
if 0, no secondary emission, if 1, secondary emission turned on
if 0 no photo-emission, if 1 photo-emission turned on, if 3 turned on with photo-electron dynamics modelling, iF 4 more (hence 5 or 7) uses user-locally-defined sun flux instead of sun direction

y-component of sun direction (points to sun, component of sun direction (points to sun, vector opposite to photons' velocity, vector norm corresponds to the amplification factor wrt the reference flux at 1 AU))
Maximum integration duration for erosion products (automatic if 0)
Maximum integration time step for particles from first interactor on SC (automatic if negative)
Numerical times speed-up factor for plasma (plasma dynamics is only integrated over a fraction 1/plasmaSpeedUp of actual physical time )
initial time step for global simulation dynamics (only used if automatic)
maximum amplification factor of the global simulation dynamics time step
Physical dimensionality of the assumptions done in code
Time step for global simulation dynamics (semi-automatic if 0: determined by lower level time step = plasmaDt, automatic if negative (-dt): increased as much as possible from the initial value dt)
flag to desactivate the dI/dV calculation: 0 => activated, 1 => disactivated (zero current variation asumed in the implicit circuit solver)
flag to have fixed integration duration dt of all populations (if yes, durations will be each population dtMax) (0=no, 1=yes)
Time step for global plasma dynamics (semi-automatic if 0: determined by lower level time step = smallest matter dt)
Duration of the simulation
(possible) scenario for the simulation
Integration duration of the plasma dynamics (automatic if 0: plasma dynamics is only integrated over a fraction 1/plasmaSpeedUp of actual physical time )

flag to define the time step evolution mode: 0 => automatic calculation (as a function of the validity: maximum time step equal simulationDt), 1 => fixed time step equal to SimulationDt (Infinite validity for the current scalers - if activated)
under-relaxation time constant for plasma (default=0 => no under-relaxation)
flag to define the circuit solver mode: 0 => implicit solver, 1 => explicit solver
type of linear system solver used in case of implicit circuit solver; 1: Gauss method; 0: Conjugate Gradient Squared (recommended)
initial potential
exact computation of CSat if > 0
File name of extra electric devices (RLCV)
Scaling parameter to globally renormalise validity of scalable currents
absolute spacecraft capacitance
SC electric circuit integration: 0=no change, 1=floating
strength of spacecraft surface potential smoothing at each step
flag to define initial pot: 0 => set to 0, 1 => set to global initPot, 2 => set to local potential defined as SC Dirichlet condition
x-component of the spacecraft velocity in the reference frame of the (drifting) plasma
y-component of the spacecraft velocity in the reference frame of the (drifting) plasma
z-component of the spacecraft velocity in the reference frame of the (drifting) plasma
flag to take account the effect induced by the spacecraft drift on the spacecraft surface potential (in the reference frame of the plasma)
number of transitions
flag for activating transition 1 (sun flux change) on the simulation configuration: 0 => none, 1.0 => yes
flag for activating transition 2 (conductivity change) on the simulation configuration: 0 => none, 1.0 => yes
Name of the Transition class to be used for transition 1 on the simulation
Name of the Transition class to be used for transition 2 on the simulation
maximal time step when the transition 1 evolves
maximal time step when the transition 2 evolves
flag to define SPIS-GEO automatic settings (1: activated)
precision of iterative particle pusher (RKCK method): absolute tolerance position
precision of iterative particle pusher (RKCK method): absolute tolerance velocity
precision of iterative particle pusher (either RKCK or dichotomy method): relative tolerance position
precision of iterative particle pusher (RKCK method): relative tolerance velocity
flag for particle pusher method used in case of magnetic field (0: RKCK algorithm from spis 4.3; 1: Dichotomy method from spis 5)
electron drift velocity along x axis (1st population)
electron drift velocity along y axis (1st population)
electron drift velocity along z axis (1st population)
electron drift velocity along x axis (2nd population)
electron drift velocity along y axis (2nd population)
electron drift velocity along z axis (2nd population)
truncation of elec density in case of fluid model
number of points of the maxwellian energy sampler
first spacing of the maxwellian energy sampler [eV]
spacing geometric factor of the maxwellian energy sampler
strength of spacecraft surface intensity smoothing at each step (1.0 => 1 step on nearest elements, can be smaller or larger than 1.0)
Population type
